page.title: 11STRATHENDRY HOUSE IN LESLIE
page.content: STRATHENDRY HOUSE WAS DESIGNED AND BUILT IN 1824 BY WILLIAM BURNS BUT WAS LIVED IN BY THE TULLIS FAMILY OF TULLIS RUSSELL PAPER MILLS.STRATHENDRY HOUSE IS SITUATED ABOUT ONE MILE WEST OF LESLIE IN THE GENTLE FOOTHILLS OF THE LOMOND HILLS WITH ITS OUTLOOK MAKING IT AN OUTSTANDING FOCAL POINT OF OUR AREA.(SEE PHOTO). THE 161 YEAR OLD HOUSE HAS 15 ROOMS BUT SURPRISINGLY HAS ONLY A DAY MAID WHO WORKS IN THE HOUSE. THE PRESENT OWNERS OWNERS HAVE NEVER TAKEN IN ANY LIVE-IN MAIDS, BUTLERS etc,BUT STILL USE IT AS A FAMLIY HOME. THE PREVIOUS OWNER THOMAS SMITH ALSO USED IT AS A FAMILY HOME WITH HELP. AROUND THE HOUSE ARE 7 ACRES OF MIXED DECIDUOUS AND CONIFEROUS TREES WHICH BOTH ACT AS SHELTER BELTS TO LANDSCAPE IT,AND AS WELL AS SOME FIELDS FOR GRAZING.
